Global

Methods

addToHistory(history, entryToAdd, options) → {Array.<Object>}

Adds an entry to the history and possible add it or join it with the latest history entry

Parameters:
Name Type Description
history Array.<Object>

history list

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
type string <optional>

type of the entry ('single', 'timeValue', 'time', 'interval)
time number <optional>

timestamp of the second entry (only type 'single')
value number <optional>

value of the first entry (only types 'single', 'time', 'interval')
reason Array.<Object>

list of reasons
timeValue Array.<Object> <optional>

array of [time, value] (only type 'timeValue')
timestamps Array.<number> <optional>

array of timestamps (only type 'time')
amount number <optional>

amount of entries joined before (only type 'interval')
firstTime number <optional>

timestamp the value was encountered first (only type 'interval')
lastTime number <optional>

timestamp the value was encoutered last (only type 'interval')
entryToAdd Object

first entry

Properties
Name Type Description
time number

timestamp of the first entry
value Object

value of the first entry
reason Array.<Object>

list of reasons
options Object

options to calculate the bounds

Properties
Name Type Description
upperBoundFactor number

factor to multiply the joined interval for the upper bound
upperBoundAddInMilliseconds number

constant to add to the joined interval for the upper bound
lowerBoundFactor number

factor to multiply the joined interval for the lower bound
lowerBoundSubInMilliseconds number

constant to sub from the joined interval for the lower bound
maxHistoryLength number

maximal amount of entries in the history
historyHysterese number

amount of entries to delete, if history exeeds max length
Source:
  • addtohistory.js, line 312
Returns:

new history (array of entries)

Type
Array.<Object>
